intro: Gardenia pulchella, commonly known as the Hawaiian gardenia, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its glossy, dark green leaves and fragrant white flowers. The plant typically grows as an evergreen shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 6 meters. Its flowers, which bloom in summer, are highly ornamental and attract pollinators such as bees and birds. Gardenia pulchella is also valued for its use in horticulture and its cultural significance in Hawaii.
